snippet: President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad will be visiting four nations — all critics of the United States. But the tour is unlikely to ease the strain of international sanctions.
abstract: Iranian Pres Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's four-nation tour of Latin America is meant to showcase his support in region against a backdrop of international tensions over his country's nuclear program, but the fact that he is not visiting any of the region's economic powerhouses underscores the increasing isolation of his country.

byline.original: By WILLIAM NEUMAN and SIMON ROMERO
byline.contributor: William Neuman reported from New York, and Simon Romero from Rio de Janeiro. María Eugenia Díaz contributed reporting from Caracas, Venezuela.

lead_paragraph: President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad will be visiting four nations — all critics of the United States. But the tour is unlikely to ease the strain of international sanctions.

headline.seo: Iranian Leader Set to Visit Allies in Latin America
headline.main: Increasingly Isolated, Iranian Leader Set to Visit Allies in Latin America
headline.print_headline: Iranian Leader, Increasingly Isolated, to Visit Latin America
